item.title: How to make a Santa Hat degrade. [Pi]
item.dc:creator: @oldschool-scape oldschool-scape
item.description:
@oldschool-scape wrote:

[quote=“3lv3n snip3r, post:5, topic:478681”]Use event/cycle handlers to make it degrade however many seconds/minutes you to be. If you want it to save, you have to add it into the PlayerSave class. Just declare an integer in the Player class. You could use something like this:

public void santaHatDegrading() { EventManager.getSingleton().addEvent(new Event() { public void execute(EventContainer c) { c.santaHat -= 1; } }, 300000); //5 minutes };
This would make the santaHat variable go down 1 every 5 minutes. This is a very simple piece of code though. You’d have to make an if statement for whenever a player’s santaHat variable got to 0, that it’d do whatever you want it to do whether it get deleted or go down to a lower stage or something. If you do use this, you’d have to either make this get called whenever a player is wearing a Santa hat or just make the if statement in the event handler itself.[/quote]

Thx, but the code you gave me kinda made that it kinda drains your c.santaHat to 0 instantly. =/

Also I ripped a Small method from a tut i used to make it degrade under fighting.

if(c.playerEquipment[c.playerHat] == 0 && c.santaHat == 0) {// Santa Degrade. c.getItems().wearItem(-1, 1, 0); // remove the equiped item c.sendMessage("Your Holiday Santa has degraded into nothing."); // send a message c.santaHat = 0; // put the degrade number back to 0 so it can degrade again @ 500 }

But that doesn’t seem to work either =/

item.title: How to make a Santa Hat degrade. [Pi]
item.dc:creator: @3lv3n_snip3r 3lv3n snip3r
item.description:
@3lv3n_snip3r wrote:

Use event/cycle handlers to make it degrade however many seconds/minutes you to be. If you want it to save, you have to add it into the PlayerSave class. Just declare an integer in the Player class. You could use something like this:

public void santaHatDegrading() { EventManager.getSingleton().addEvent(new Event() { public void execute(EventContainer c) { c.santaHat -= 1; } }, 300000); //5 minutes };
This would make the santaHat variable go down 1 every 5 minutes. This is a very simple piece of code though. You’d have to make an if statement for whenever a player’s santaHat variable got to 0, that it’d do whatever you want it to do whether it get deleted or go down to a lower stage or something. If you do use this, you’d have to either make this get called whenever a player is wearing a Santa hat or just make the if statement in the event handler itself.
